application_id.description: ApplicationID of the DM creator Zeroed if guild channel or not a bot user

bitrate.description: The bitrate of the channel, if it is a voice channel.

guild_id.description:
The ID of the guild to which the channel belongs, if it is in a guild.
Else, this ID is empty (e.g. DM channels).

icon.description: Icon of the group DM channel.

last_message_id.description:
The ID of the last message sent in the channel. This is not
guaranteed to be an ID of a valid message.

last_pin_timestamp.description:
The timestamp of the last pinned message in the channel.
nil if the channel has no pinned messages.

member_count.description: An approximate count of users in a thread, stops counting at 50

message_count.description: An approximate count of messages in a thread, stops counting at 50

nsfw.description: Whether the channel is marked as NSFW.

owner_id.description: ID of the creator of the group DM or thread

parent_id.description: The ID of the parent channel, if the channel is under a category. For threads - id of the channel thread was created in.

permission_overwrites.description: A list of permission overwrites present for the channel.

position.description: The position of the channel, used for sorting in client.

rate_limit_per_user.description:
Amount of seconds a user has to wait before sending another message or creating another thread (0-21600)
bots, as well as users with the permission manage_messages or manage_channel, are unaffected

recipients.description: The recipients of the channel. This is only populated in DM channels.

thread_member.description: Thread member object for the current user, if they have joined the thread, only included on certain API endpoints

thread_metadata.description: Thread-specific fields not needed by other channels

user_limit.description: The user limit of the voice channel.

avatar.description: The hash of the avatar for the guild member, if any.

communication_disabled_until.description:
The time at which the member's timeout will expire.
Time in the past or nil if the user is not timed out.

deaf.description: Whether the member is deafened at a guild level.

guild_id.description: The guild ID on which the member exists.

joined_at.description: The time at which the member joined the guild.

mute.description: Whether the member is muted at a guild level.

nick.description: The nickname of the member, if they have one.

pending.description: Is true while the member hasn't accepted the membership screen.

permissions.description: Total permissions of the member in the channel, including overrides, returned when in the interaction object.

premium_since.description: When the user used their Nitro boost on the server

roles.description: A list of IDs of the roles which are possessed by the member.

user.description: The underlying user on which the member is based.

activity.description: Is sent with Rich Presence-related chat embeds

application.description: Is sent with Rich Presence-related chat embeds

attachments.description: A list of attachments present in the message.

author.description:
The author of the message. This is not guaranteed to be a
valid user (webhook-sent messages do not possess a full author).

channel_id.description: The ID of the channel in which the message was sent.

edited_timestamp.description:
The time at which the last edit of the message
occurred, if it has been edited.

embeds.description: A list of embeds present in the message.

flags.description:
The flags of the message, which describe extra features of a message.
This is a combination of bit masks; the presence of a certain permission can
be checked by performing a bitwise AND between this int and the flag.

guild_id.description: The ID of the guild in which the message was sent.

interaction.description:
Is sent when the message is a response to an Interaction, without an existing message.
This means responses to message component interactions do not include this property,
instead including a MessageReference, as components exist on preexisting messages.

member.description:
Member properties for this message's author,
contains only partial information

mention_channels.description:
Channels specifically mentioned in this message
Not all channel mentions in a message will appear in mention_channels.
Only textual channels that are visible to everyone in a lurkable guild will ever be included.
Only crossposted messages (via Channel Following) currently include mention_channels at all.
If no mentions in the message meet these requirements, this field will not be sent.

mention_roles.description: The roles mentioned in the message.

mentions.description: A list of users mentioned in the message.

message_reference.description:
MessageReference contains reference data sent with crossposted or reply messages.
This does not contain the reference *to* this message; this is for when *this* message references another.
To generate a reference to this message, use (*Message).Reference().

pinned.description: Whether the message is pinned or not.

reactions.description: A list of reactions to the message.

referenced_message.description:
The message associated with the message_reference
NOTE: This field is only returned for messages with a type of 19 (REPLY) or 21 (THREAD_STARTER_MESSAGE).
If the message is a reply but the referenced_message field is not present,
the backend did not attempt to fetch the message that was being replied to, so its state is unknown.
If the field exists but is null, the referenced message was deleted.

sticker_items.description: An array of Sticker objects, if any were sent.

thread.description: The thread that was started from this message, includes thread member object

timestamp.description:
The time at which the messsage was sent.
CAUTION: this field may be removed in a
future API version; it is safer to calculate
the creation time via the ID.

webhook_id.description: The webhook ID of the message, if it was generated by a webhook

member.description: Member is only present when the interaction is from a guild.

color.description: The hex color of this role.

hoist.description: Whether this role is hoisted (shows up separately in member list).

managed.description:
Whether this role is managed by an integration, and
thus cannot be manually added to, or taken from, members.

permissions.description:
The permissions of the role on the guild (doesn't include channel overrides).
This is a combination of bit masks; the presence of a certain permission can
be checked by performing a bitwise AND between this int and the permission.

position.description: The position of this role in the guild's role hierarchy.

flags.description: Any user-thread settings, currently only used for notifications

join_timestamp.description: The time the current user last joined the thread

archive_timestamp.description: Timestamp when the thread's archive status was last changed, used for calculating recent activity

auto_archive_duration.description: Duration in minutes to automatically archive the thread after recent activity, can be set to: 60, 1440, 4320, 10080

invitable.description: Whether non-moderators can add other non-moderators to a thread; only available on private threads

locked.description: Whether the thread is locked; when a thread is locked, only users with MANAGE_THREADS can unarchive it

accent_color.description: User's banner color, encoded as an integer representation of hexadecimal color code

avatar.description:
The hash of the user's avatar. Use Session.UserAvatar
to retrieve the avatar itself.

banner.description: The hash of the user's banner image.

bot.description: Whether the user is a bot.

discriminator.description: The discriminator of the user (4 numbers after name).

email.description:
The email of the user. This is only present when
the application possesses the email scope for the user.

flags.description:
The flags on a user's account.
Only available when the request is authorized via a Bearer token.

mfa_enabled.description: Whether the user has multi-factor authentication enabled.

premium_type.description:
The type of Nitro subscription on a user's account.
Only available when the request is authorized via a Bearer token.

public_flags.description:
The public flags on a user's account.
This is a combination of bit masks; the presence of a certain flag can
be checked by performing a bitwise AND between this int and the flag.

system.description: Whether the user is an Official Discord System user (part of the urgent message system).

token.description:
The token of the user. This is only present for
the user represented by the current session.

verified.description: Whether the user's email is verified.

avatar.description: The hash of the avatar for the guild member, if any.

communication_disabled_until.description:
The time at which the member's timeout will expire.
Time in the past or nil if the user is not timed out.

deaf.description: Whether the member is deafened at a guild level.

guild_id.description: The guild ID on which the member exists.

joined_at.description: The time at which the member joined the guild.

mute.description: Whether the member is muted at a guild level.

nick.description: The nickname of the member, if they have one.

pending.description: Is true while the member hasn't accepted the membership screen.

permissions.description: Total permissions of the member in the channel, including overrides, returned when in the interaction object.

premium_since.description: When the user used their Nitro boost on the server

roles.description: A list of IDs of the roles which are possessed by the member.

user.description: The underlying user on which the member is based.

accent_color.description: User's banner color, encoded as an integer representation of hexadecimal color code

avatar.description:
The hash of the user's avatar. Use Session.UserAvatar
to retrieve the avatar itself.

banner.description: The hash of the user's banner image.

bot.description: Whether the user is a bot.

discriminator.description: The discriminator of the user (4 numbers after name).

email.description:
The email of the user. This is only present when
the application possesses the email scope for the user.

flags.description:
The flags on a user's account.
Only available when the request is authorized via a Bearer token.

mfa_enabled.description: Whether the user has multi-factor authentication enabled.

premium_type.description:
The type of Nitro subscription on a user's account.
Only available when the request is authorized via a Bearer token.

public_flags.description:
The public flags on a user's account.
This is a combination of bit masks; the presence of a certain flag can
be checked by performing a bitwise AND between this int and the flag.

system.description: Whether the user is an Official Discord System user (part of the urgent message system).

token.description:
The token of the user. This is only present for
the user represented by the current session.

verified.description: Whether the user's email is verified.
